STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
September 1, 2022
Carol Kehoe
Ingham County DHHS
P. O. Box 30088
Lansing, MI 48909
RE: License #: CP330201190
Investigation #: 2022C0444021
Ingham County DHHS
Dear Ms. Kehoe:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP330201190
Investigation #: 2022C0444021
Complaint Receipt Date: 08/04/2022
Investigation Initiation Date: 08/04/2022
Report Due Date: 10/03/2022
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Address: 235 South Grand Avenue
Lansing, MI 48902
Licensee Telephone #: (517) 373-3768
Administrator: Carol Kehoe, Administrator
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling, Designee
Name of Facility: Ingham County DHHS
Facility Address: 5303 S Cedar Street
Lansing, MI 48909
Facility Telephone #: (517) 887-9791
Original Issuance Date: 10/01/1991
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 12/01/2020
Expiration Date: 11/30/2022
Capacity: Unknown
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, FIA
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Agency did not provide adequate notice to foster parent before Yes
replacing a foster child.
III. METHODOLOGY
08/04/2022 Special Investigation Intake
2022C0444021
08/04/2022 Special Investigation Initiated - Letter
Email to Director to advise of new complaint
08/04/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed Complainant
08/08/2022 Inspection Completed On-site
08/08/2022 Contact - Face to Face
Interviewed Foster Care supervisor
08/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed Foster Care worker
08/29/2022 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
08/31/2022 Pre-exit meeting with Chief Administrator and Program Manager
ALLEGATION:
Agency did not provide adequate notice to foster parent before replacing a foster
child.
INVESTIGATION:
Chief Administrator was advised of new complaint on August 4, 2022.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on August 4, 2022, and a follow up
interview occurred on August 16, 2022. Complainant stated Youth A was placed in
her home on June 22, 2022. She stated the agency advised her of concerns
regarding the condition of her home and informed her the concerns would need to
be rectified. Complainant stated she was not given a timeframe the repairs needed
to be completed. On July 21, 2022, Complainant stated she received an email from
Foster Care worker indicating a placement meeting was scheduled for July 25, 2022.
During the meeting on July 25, 2022, Complainant stated the agency told her they
were considering moving Youth A to another placement. On August 2, 2022, Foster
Care worker moved Youth A to another relative placement.
FC Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August 8, 2022. FC
Supervision stated a Team Decision Making Meeting was held on July 25, 2022, and
the Complainant was on the call. During the meeting there was discussion regarding
the concerns with Complainant’s home and the amount of time since Youth A was
placed in the home with little to no progress being made. FC Supervisor stated the
2

Complainant was told the home assessment was denied and Youth A would be
moved to another relative placement. FC Supervisor stated FCW completed the
DHS 30, Foster Parent/Caregiver Notice of Move and provided it to Complainant on
August 2, 2022.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on August 29, 2022. FCW
stated she was hired by the agency April 4, 2022, and completed training June 10,
2022, and was not aware that she was required to provide 14 days written notice
when moving a foster child. FCW stated the 3130A that was completed on
Complainant’s house was denied and Complainant was notified Youth A would likely
be moved during a Team Decision Making meeting on July 25, 2022, but she did not
provide written notice until August 2, 2022, when Youth A was moved to another
relative placement.
Documents Reviewed:
 DHS 5966 Team Decision Making Meeting report dated July 25, 2022.
Reason for meeting states a placement change may be needed for Youth A
due to concerns with Complainant’s home.
 DHS 30 Foster Parent/Caregiver Notice of Move dated August 2, 2022.
 MISCAWIS case record for Youth A shows she was placed with Complainant
from June 22, 2022, until August 2, 2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(i) That the current foster parent was notified in writing of the
following information:
(i) Not less than 14 calendar days in advance, of the
change, except when prior notification would jeopardize the
child's care or safety. If prior notice is not provided, then the
agency shall notify the foster parent, at the time of the change,
why prior notice was not given.
(ii) Of the current foster parent's rights concerning the
change in placement.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in noncompliance as Youth A was moved
to another placement on August 2, 2022 the same day
Complainant was provided written notification that Youth A was
being moved to another placement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend no change to the license status of this child placing agency.
___________8/31/2022__________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 1, 2022
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
